meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I always flub my lines during the school play.
meanings.sent2: She tends to flub her math problems when she rushes through them.
meanings.sent3: During the talent show, he managed to flub his magic trick, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The singer flubbed the high note, causing the audience to cringe.
meanings.sent5: Try not to flub your presentation by practicing beforehand.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error made in speech or action.
meanings.sent1: Her flub during the debate cost her the election.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's flub on stage became the highlight of the show.
meanings.sent3: The chef's flub in the kitchen led to a hilarious cooking disaster.
meanings.sent4: The politician's flub in the interview became a viral meme.
meanings.sent5: Don't worry about the little flub you made; everyone makes mistakes.
